_prev_prog_3.Description: A PSM Plan has been developed for the chlorination system at the Millington WWTP.  The PSM includes Process Hazard Analysis, Standard Operating Procedures, training, and inspections.  The system is monioter using chlorine sensors which trigger an alarm system if chlorine is detected.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This document contains all required information in order to meet 40 CFR 68 "Risk Management Program". This document consists of the executive summary and registration data elements (68.155 through 68.185).

1.0    RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The Millington Wastewater Treatment Plant (MWWTP) has chlorine on site that requires protection as defined under the Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation (29 CFR 1926.64).  The City of Millington, TN, has implemented a PSM program to provide information to employees to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling and processing of highly hazardous materials.  The program emphasizes the application of management controls and standard operating procedures when addressing the risks associated with handling or working near highly hazardous chemicals.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) summarizes the worst case scenarios for a release of chlorine, the management systems and monitoring systems in place to prevent such a release, and the training and employee participation in the PSM program.

In accordance with the 2004 amendment to the RMP regulations, the off-site consequence analyses (OCA) are not included in this executive summary.

2.0    PROCESS DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The MWWTP treats and disposes of all sanitary waste discharged to the City Sewer System.  The facility utilizes 1-ton cylinders to treat the wastewater in the chlorination room.  One cylinder is always connected to the chlorination system and one cylinder is always stored as a backup. The MWWTP also uses sulfur dioxide cylinders to treat wastewater, but stores less than the 5,000-pound threshold for RMP reporting.   

3.0    GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL - SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The MWWTP has developed an OSHA PSM program for the chlorination system.. At MWWTP, chlorine falls under the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program, which is identical

to the OSHA PSM program. EPA has said that if the process is in compliance with OSHA PSM, then it is compliance with RMP Program 3. Thus, MWWTP chlorine PSM has been reviewed and determined to be complete for the RMP document. 

Annual waste water operator certification and continuing education maintains and continually improves safety at the MWWTP. 

4.0    FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There has been no reportable release from MWWTP in the last five years. 

5.0    EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

MWWTP has developed an Emergency Response Plan. The response plan is a detailed document which discusses the role of employees and management in an emergency situation. The plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations for plant personnel. For all emergencies, City of Millington Safety Officer, has operating authority for emergency response at the site of release and assumes control of the incident scene beyond the first responder awareness level.

This document contains specific information regarding: contact numbers; emergency communication; incident team job descriptions; evacuation zones; emergency evacuation procedures; notification procedures; training; emergency shutdown procedures; personnel roles and lines of authority; emergency recognition and prevention; safe distances and places of refuge; site security and control; medical/first aid treatment; emergency alerting and response procedures; PPE and emergency equipment; and standard operating procedures in the event of a chlorine release.

6.0    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Due to the MWWTPA?s, exemplary safety record no changes to the existing safety plan have been identified.
